kevalin：a．[kevala-in] 独存の，純一の，完全の．

Kevalin，（adj．） [fr．kevala] one who is fully accomplished，an Arahant； often with mahesi and uttamapurisa．Defn sabbaguṇa -- paripuṇṇa sabba -- yoga -- visaṁyutta SnA．153．-- ye suvimuttā te kevalino ye kevalino vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññâpanāya S．III，59 sq．，i．e．“those who are thoroughly emancipated，these are the accomplished ．．．”； kevalīnaṁ mahesiṁ khīṇ’āsavaṁ Sn．82=S．I，167； -- k．vusitavā uttamapuriso Nd2 on tiṇṇa=A．V，16．-- with Gen．：brahmacariyassa k．“perfected in morality” A．II，23．-- As Ep．of “brāhmaṇa” Sn．519=Nd2 s．v．； of dhammacakka A．II，9； see also Sn．490，595．-- akevalin not accomplished，not perfected Sn．878，891．（Page 226）
